name: hyphenation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the use of the symbol -, joining two words or two parts of a word: the rules of hyphenation Differences in hyphenation can result from differences in pronunciation. The production calls itself a "mystery-comedy", and the hyphenation doesn't end there: it also adds "melodrama-farce". See
hyphenate
More examplesFewer examplesBad hyphenation is inexcusable in a book of this kind.The problem could have been a spelling error, hyphenation problem, or transposed number.No matter the clumsiness of hyphenation, her sons would have both her name and her husband's.
